specJson.name: brightics.function.recommendation$als_recommend
specJson.description:
Matrix factorization is a class of collaborative filtering algorithms used in recommender systems. Matrix factorization algorithms work by decomposing the user-item iteraction matrix into the product of two lower dimensionality rectangular matrices. One matrix is a user latent vector where rows represent users and columns are latent factors. The other matrix is a item latent vector where rows are latent factors and columns represent items. And Rating of item _i_ given by user _u_ can be expressed as a dot product of the user latent vector and the item latent vector.

ALS(Alternating Least Squares) is also a matrix factorization algorithm and it runs itself in a parallel fashion. The idea behind ALS is to minimize two loss funcitions alternatively. It first holds user matrix fixed and runs gradient descent with item matrix. Then it holds item matrix fixed and runs gradient descent with user matrix. ALS is doing a pretty good job at solving scalability and sparseness of the ratings data, and it's simple and scales well to very large datasets.

Reference:
+ <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Matrix_factorization_(recommender_systems)>
+ <http://stanford.edu/~rezab/classes/cme323/S15/notes/lec14.pdf>
+ <https://towardsdatascience.com/prototyping-a-recommender-system-step-by-step-part-2-alternating-least-square-als-matrix-4a76c58714a1>

params.label: Number of recommendations
params.description: Number of recommendations in the top N list.

params.label: Filter already liked items
params.description:
Whether to filter already liked items. If `True`, it does not recommend the items that user already rated.
   - Available Options : `True`, `False`

params.label: Target Users
params.description: Target users to recommend top N items. Default is all users found in data.

params.label: Implicit Preference
params.description:
Whether to use the explicit feedback ALS variant or one adapted for implicit feedback data.
   - Available Options : `True`, `False`

params.label: Seed
params.description: Random seed. Use the same seed in order to reproduce the same results.

params.label: Rank
params.description: Number of latent factors to use in the model.

params.label: Workers
params.description: Number of workers. Recommended only if target is all.

summary.en: This function recommends Top-N items for users by using the ALS(alternating least squares) algorithm based recommender model.
summary.ko: 한글 - This function recommends Top-N items for users by using the ALS(alternating least squares) algorithm based recommender model.

md.en:
# ALS Recommend This function recommends Top-N items for users by using the ALS(alternating least squares) algorithm based recommender model. ## Description Matrix factorization is a class of collaborative filtering algorithms used in recommender systems. Matrix factorization algorithms work by decomposing the user-item interaction matrix into the product of two lower dimensionality rectangular matrices. One matrix is a user latent vector where rows represent users and columns are latent factors. The other matrix is a item latent vector where rows are latent factors and columns represent items. And Rating of item _i_ given by user _u_ can be expressed as a dot product of the user latent vector and the item latent vector. ALS(Alternating Least Squares) is also a matrix factorization algorithm and it runs itself in a parallel fashion. The idea behind ALS is to minimize two loss functions alternatively. It first holds user matrix fixed and runs gradient descent with item matrix. Then it holds item matrix fixed and runs gradient descent with user matrix. ALS is doing a pretty good job at solving scalability and sparseness of the ratings data, and it's simple and scales well to very large datasets. Reference + + + ## Properties ### VA #### INPUT 1. **table***: (Table) Data in a Table. It must contain `User Column`, `Item Column` and `Rating Column` used in model training. #### OUTPUT 1. **table**: (Table) Recommendations of Top-N items for each users with the predicted ratings. #### PARAMETER 1. **User Column***: User column name. 2. **Item Column***: Item column name. 3. **Rating Column***: Rating column names. 4. **Number of recommendations**: Number of recommendations in the top N list. 5. **Filter already liked items**: Whether to filter already liked items. If `True`, it does not recommend the items that user already rated. 6. **Target Users**: Target users to recommend top N items. Default is all users found in data. 7. **Implicit Preference**: Whether to use the explicit feedback ALS variant or one adapted for implicit feedback data. 8. **Iterations**: Maximum number of iteration. 9. **Reg Param**: Regularization parameter in ALS. 10. **Seed**: Random seed. Use the same seed in order to reproduce the same results. 11. **Rank**: Number of latent factors to use in the model. 12. **Alpha**: The alpha parameter used in computing confidence in implicit ALS. 13. **Group By**: Columns to group by. 14. **Workers**: Number of workers. Recommended only if target is all. ### Python #### USAGE ``` als_recommend(table = , user_col = , item_col = , rating_col = , number = , filter = , targets = , implicit = , iterations = , reg_param = , seed = , rank = , alpha = , group_by = , workers = ) ``` #### INPUT 1. **table***: (Table) Data in a Table. It must contain `user_col`, `item_col` and `rating_col` used in model training. #### OUTPUT 1. **table**: (Table) Recommendations of Top-N items for each users with the predicted ratings. #### PARAMETER 1. **user_col***: User column name. * Type: *str* 2. **item_col***: Item column name. * Type: *str* 3. **rating_col***: Rating column names. * Type: *str* 4. **number**: Number of recommendations in the top N list. * Type: *int* * Default / Range: 10 (value >= 1) 5. **filter**: Whether to filter already liked items. If `True`, it does not recommend the items that user already rated. * Type: *boolean* * Default / Range: true 6. **targets**: Target users to recommend top N items. Default is all users found in data. * Type: *int*, *float*, *str* 7. **implicit**: Whether to use the explicit feedback ALS variant or one adapted for implicit feedback data. * Type: *boolean* * Default / Range: false 8. **iterations**: Maximum number of iteration. * Type: *int* * Default / Range: 10 (value >= 1) 9. **reg_param**: Regularization parameter in ALS. * Type: *float* * Default / Range: 0.1 (value >= 0) 10. **seed**: Random seed. Use the same seed in order to reproduce the same results. * Type: *int* 11. **rank**: Number of latent factors to use in the model. * Type: *int* * Default / Range: 10 (value >= 1) 12. **alpha**: The alpha parameter used in computing confidence in implicit ALS. * Type: *float* * Default / Range: 1.0 (value >= 0) 13. **group_by**: Columns to group by. * Type: *list[str]* 14. **workers**: Number of workers. Recommended only if target is all. * Type: *int* ## Example ### VA **[Sample Model]**
In this tutorial workflow, sample_ALSTrain is used to recommend Top-N items by using the ALS(Alternating Least Squares) algorithm based recommender model. By using ALS Recommend function, we can get recommendations of Top-N items for users in the data with predicted ratings. The parameter settings used in the function are shown below. ++Parameters++ 1. **User Column***: user 2. **Item Column***: item 3. **Rating Column***: rating 4. **Number of recommendations**: 10 5. **Filter already liked items**: True 6. **Target Users**: None 7. **Implicit Preference**: False 8. **Iterations**: 10 9. **Reg Param**: 0.1 10. **Seed**: None 11. **Rank**: 10 12. **Group By**: None 13. **Workers**: 1 ### Python ``` from brightics.function.recommendation import als_recommend input_table = inputs[0] result = als_recommend(table=input_table, user_col='user', item_col='item', rating_col='rating', number=10, filter=True, targets=None, implicit=False, iterations=10, reg_param=0.1, seed=None, rank=10, alpha=1.0, workers=1, group_by=None) output = result['out_table'] ```
In this python script, sample_ALSTrain is used to recommend Top-N items by using the ALS(Alternating Least Squares) algorithm based recommender model. By using ALS Recommend function, we can get recommendations of Top-N items for users in the data with predicted ratings.
md.kr:
# ALS Recommend 이 함수는 ALS (alternating least squares) 알고리즘 기반 추천 모델을 사용하여 사용자에게 Top-N 항목을 추천한다. ## Description 매트릭스 인수 분해는 추천 시스템에서 사용되는 collaborative filtering algorithms 클래스이다. 행렬 분해 알고리즘은 사용자 항목 반복 행렬을 두 개의 낮은 차원의 직사각형 행렬의 곱으로 분해하여 작동한다. 하나의 행렬은 행이 사용자를 나타내고 열이 잠재 요인 인 사용자 잠재 벡터이다. 다른 행렬은 행이 잠재 요인이고 열이 항목을 나타내는 항목 잠재 벡터이다. 그리고 사용자 _u_에 의해 주어진 아이템 _i_의 등급은 사용자 잠재 벡터 및 아이템 잠재 벡터로 표현 될 수 있다. ALS (Alternating Least Squares)는 행렬 인수 분해 알고리즘이며 병렬 방식으로 실행된다. ALS의 기본 개념은 두 가지 loss function을 최소화하는 것이다. 먼저 사용자 행렬을 고정하고 항목 행렬로 경사 하강을 실행한다. 그런 다음 항목 매트릭스를 고정하고 사용자 매트릭스로 gradient descent를 실행한다. ALS는 등급 데이터의 확장성 및 축소를 해결하는데 용이하며, 단순하고 큰 데이터 셋으로 확장할 수 있다. Reference + + + ## Properties ### VA #### INPUT 1. **table***: (Table) 테이블의 데이터. 모델 학습에 사용되는 `User Column`, `Item Column`및 `Rating Column`이 포함되어야한다. #### OUTPUT 1. **table**: (Table) 각 사용자의 예측 등급을 Top-N 아이템으로 추천. #### PARAMETER 1. **User Column***: 사용자 컬럼명. 2. **Item Column***: 아이템 컬럼명. 3. **Rating Column***: 등급 컬럼명. 4. **Number of recommendations**: top N 리스트의 추천 갯수. 5. **Filter already liked items**: 미리 선호하는 항목을 필터링할지 여부. `True`인 경우 사용자가 미리 평가한 항목을 추천하지 않는다. 6. **Target Users**: 상위 N 개 항목을 추천하도록 사용자를 타겟팅한다. 기본값은 데이터에서 찾은 모든 사용자이다. 7. **Implicit Preference**: 명시적 피드백 ALS variant 또는 암시적 피드백 데이터에 적합한 variant 사용 여부 8. **Iterations**: 최대 반복 횟수. 9. **Reg Param**: ALS의 정규화 매개 변수. 10. **Seed**: Random seed. 동일한 결과를 재현하려면 동일한 시드를 사용해라. 11. **Rank**: 모형에 사용할 latent factor 수이다. 12. **Alpha**: implicit ALS의 신뢰도를 계산하는 데 사용되는 알파 매개 변수이다. 13. **Group By**: 그룹핑할 컬럼. 14. **Workers**: 작업수. 전체 대상일때에만 사용한다. ### Python #### USAGE ``` als_recommend(table = , user_col = , item_col = , rating_col = , number = , filter = , targets = , implicit = , iterations = , reg_param = , seed = , rank = , alpha = , group_by = , workers = ) ``` #### INPUT 1. **table***: (Table) 테이블의 데이터. 모델 학습에 사용되는 `User Column`, `Item Column`및 `Rating Column`이 포함되어야 한다. #### OUTPUT 1. **out_table**: (Table) 각 사용자의 예측 등급을 Top-N 아이템으로 추천. #### PARAMETER 1. **user_col***: 사용자 컬럼명. * Type: *str* 2. **item_col***: 아이템 컬럼명. * Type: *str* 3. **rating_col***: 등급 컬럼명. * Type: *str* 4. **number**: top N 리스트의 추천 갯수. * Type: *int* * Default / Range: 10 (1 <= value) 5. **filter**: 미리 선호하는 항목을 필터링할지 여부. `True`인 경우 사용자가 미리 평가한 항목을 추천하지 않는다. * Type: *boolean* * Default value: true 6. **targets**: 상위 N 개 항목을 추천하도록 사용자를 타겟팅한다. 기본값은 데이터에서 찾은 모든 사용자이다. * Type: *int*, *float*, *str* 7. **implicit**: 명시적 피드백 ALS variant 또는 암시적 피드백 데이터에 적합한 variant 사용 여부 * Type: *boolean* * Default value: false 8. **iterations**: 최대 반복 횟수. * Type: *int* * Default / Range: 10 (1 <= value) 9. **reg_param**: ALS의 정규화 매개 변수. * Type: *float* * Default / Range: 0.1 (0 <= value) 10. **seed**: Random seed. 동일한 결과를 재현하려면 동일한 시드를 사용해라. * Type: *int* 11. **rank**: 모형에 사용할 latent factor 수이다. * Type: *int* * Default / Range: 10 (1 <= value) 12. **alpha**: implicit ALS의 신뢰도를 계산하는 데 사용되는 알파 매개 변수이다. * Type: *float* * Default / Range: 1.0 (0 <= value) 13. **group_by**: 그룹핑할 컬럼. * Type: *list[str]* 14. **workers**: 작업수. 전체 대상일때에만 사용한다. * Type: *int* ## Example ### VA **[Sample Model]**
이 워크플로 예시에서 sample_ALSTrain은 ALS (Alternating Least Squares) 알고리즘 기반 추천 모델을 사용하여 Top-N 항목을 추천하는 데 사용된다. ALS 권장 기능을 사용하면 예측된 등급의 데이터에서 사용자를 위한 Top-N 항목의 권장 사항을 구할수 있다. 이 기능에 사용 된 파라미터 설정은 다음과 같다. ++Parameters++ 1. **User Column***: user 2. **Item Column***: item 3. **Rating Column***: rating 4. **Number of recommendations**: 10 5. **Filter already liked items**: True 6. **Target Users**: None 7. **Implicit Preference**: False 8. **Iterations**: 10 9. **Reg Param**: 0.1 10. **Seed**: None 11. **Rank**: 10 12. **Group By**: None 13. **Workers**: 1 ### Python ``` from brightics.function.recommendation import als_recommend input_table = inputs[0] result = als_recommend(table=input_table, user_col='user', item_col='item', rating_col='rating', number=10, filter=True, targets=None, implicit=False, iterations=10, reg_param=0.1, seed=None, rank=10, alpha=1.0, workers=1, group_by=None) output = result['out_table'] ```
이 파이썬 스크립트에서 sample_ALSTrain은 ALS (Alternating Least Squares) 알고리즘 기반 추천 모델을 사용하여 Top-N 아이템을 추천하는 데 사용된다. ALS 권장 기능을 사용하면 예측된 등급의 데이터에서 사용자를 위한 Top-N 항목의 권장 사항을 구할수 있다.
